block.p: Abigail Sirota, the daughter of Dr. Barbara L. Sirota and Dr. David Sirota of New York, is to be married this evening to Dr. Joshua Heath Rothenberg, the son of Shelly and Alan Rothenberg of Holbrook, N.Y. Cantor Robert P. Abelson is to officiate at the Puck Building.

The bride, 26, is a clinical social worker at the North Shore Child and Family Guidance Center, a social services agency in Roslyn, N.Y. She graduated from the University of Colorado and received a master's degree in social work from Columbia. Her father, a retired industrial and organizational psychologist, is the former owner of the Sirota Consulting Corporation, a corporate advisory service in Purchase, N.Y. Her mother, a clinical social worker, works in New York as a court-appointed advocate for children in the foster-care system.

Abigail Sirota, the daughter of Dr. Barbara L. Sirota and Dr. David Sirota of New York, is to be married this evening to Dr. Joshua Heath Rothenberg, the son of Shelly and Alan Rothenberg of Holbrook, N.Y. Cantor Robert P. Abelson is to officiate at the Puck Building.

The bride, 26, is a clinical social worker at the North Shore Child and Family Guidance Center, a social services agency in Roslyn, N.Y. She graduated from the University of Colorado and received a master's degree in social work from Columbia. Her father, a retired industrial and organizational psychologist, is the former owner of the Sirota Consulting Corporation, a corporate advisory service in Purchase, N.Y. Her mother, a clinical social worker, works in New York as a court-appointed advocate for children in the foster-care system.

The bridegroom, 30, is an associate at a private orthodontic practice in Stony Brook, N.Y. He graduated from the State University at Binghamton, N.Y., and received his dental degree and a certificate in orthodontics from New York University. His mother is the controller of the Lakeville Pace Mechanical Company, plumbing contractors in Lindenhurst, N.Y. His father is a physical education teacher at the Ludlum School, a public elementary school in Hempstead, N.Y.
